title: Operating Room Registered Scrub Nurse - Orthopaedic and Spine Surgery
description:
**Job Summary:** As an Operating Room Registered Scrub Nurse specializing in Orthopaedic and Spine Surgery, you will play a critical role in the surgical team, ensuring a sterile environment, preparing specialized instruments, and assisting orthopaedic and spine surgeons during procedures. Your expertise in these surgical specialties will contribute to delivering high-quality patient care and successful surgical outcomes.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Preparation and Setup:** Prepare the operating room for orthopaedic and spine surgeries, ensuring all necessary equipment, implants, and specialized instruments are sterile and ready for use.
* **Assistance to Surgeons:** Assist orthopaedic and spine surgeons during procedures by anticipating their needs, passing instruments and implants, and providing support to maintain a sterile field.
* **Patient Care:** Assess patients pre-operatively, monitor their vital signs during surgery, and provide post-operative care specific to orthopaedic and spine procedures.
* **Specialized Knowledge:** Demonstrate proficiency in orthopaedic and spine surgical techniques, including positioning patients for surgery, handling specialized implants (e.g., plates, screws), and assisting with intraoperative imaging (e.g., fluoroscopy).
* **Team Collaboration:** Collaborate closely with orthopaedic surgeons, neurosurgeons, anesthesiologists, and other surgical team members to ensure coordinated patient care and optimal surgical outcomes.
* **Safety and Sterility:** Adhere rigorously to sterile technique and infection control protocols specific to orthopaedic and spine surgeries to minimize the risk of surgical site infections and ensure patient safety.
* **Documentation and Reporting:** Accurately document all aspects of patient care, surgical procedures, and implant usage in compliance with hospital policies and regulatory standards.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Graduation from an accredited school of nursing with a current state license as a registered nurse (RN).
* **Certification:** Certification in perioperative nursing (CNOR) preferred, with additional certifications or training specific to orthopaedic and spine surgery highly desirable.
* **Experience:** Minimum of 2 years of experience as a scrub nurse in orthopaedic and spine surgery, with proficiency in handling specialized equipment and implants.
* **Skills:** In-depth knowledge of orthopaedic and spine surgical procedures, including familiarity with common surgical techniques and implants. Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced surgical environment.
company_addresses: 4 Westbrook Corporate Center, Suite 430, Westchester, IL 60154

title: SVP Global Communications and Brand | OVG NY Corporate
description:
Oak View Group:

Oak View Group is the global leader in venue development, management, and premium hospitality services for the live event industry. Offering an unmatched, 360-degree solution set for a collection of world-class owned venues and a client roster that includes the most influential, highest attended arenas, convention centers, music festivals, performing arts centers, and cultural institutions on the planet.
Position Summary:

The SVP Global Communications & Brand will lead the brand storytelling and global external communications function responsible for the voice, positioning, and storytelling of OVG and its sub-brands that reflects the company values and business interests in desired markets. The candidate will work closely with Executive leaders to oversee strategic brand growth through messaging, world class creative design, and proactive and reactive communications strategies aligned with key prospects and target audiences.  

The SVP will lead the Communications function Corporately as well as Internationallyl as well as lead Creative Services and Brand development and strategy. The SVP will also serve as a vital resource for all venue teams ensuring alignment and consistency of messaging, promoting key milestones and managing crisis communications. **Benefits for FT roles: Benefits: Health, Dental and Vision insurance, 401(k) savings plan, 401(k) matching, and paid time off (vacation days, sick days, and 12 holidays).** **Salary range is $250,000- $275,000 per year plus bonus** **This position will remain open until October 1, 2024**
Responsibilities:* Create, implement and oversee cohesive external communications and PR programs that are supportive of, and advance, OVG’s brand identity and broaden awareness of its businesses and priorities.
* Develop and implement an annual communications strategy to reflect the organization’s strategic vision and support overall business objectives. Increase awareness and understanding of OVG brand, priority verticals, products and initiatives in business and consumer press, ensuring alignment and integration with PR plans from the business verticals.
* Act as a primary contact for crisis communications with the goal of protecting OVG overall, its brands and assets, reinforcing reputation as a responsible entity. Support the continued evolution of the company’s crisis response capability, including ongoing review and development of crisis communication processes and procedures, crisis exercises for the senior leadership team, as well as educating, training, preparation, and process improvement as appropriate.
* In conjunction with our business leaders in global markets, manage and strategize with lobbying agencies to secure and sustain OVG’s interests with government entities and constituents.
* Establish and own a central messaging platform to keep all information up to data and available to all business units.
* Oversee and develop a world class Creative Services team that works cohesively to deliver on the OVG and sub brand vision across multiple divisions and touchpoints with B2C and B2B constituents.
* Develop and monitor PR KPI’s; report monthly
* Manage day-to-day relationship and performance of team, agencies and vendor relationships for PR / communications as needed
* Identify and create strategic media opportunities for executive leadership to tell the OVG story in target media and communities. Develop messaging, prepare briefing materials and brief spokespersons in preparation for media interviews.
* Oversee and ensure the cohesive messaging for OVG globally, adapted for region specific needs.

 **Team Development/Management*** Build relationships with business and PR leaders in each vertical business
* Recruit and manage and develop a Creative Services Team, content/messaging owner and UK comms lead.
* Oversee multiple agency and freelancer relationships.

  


Qualifications:
* Bachelor's degree in communications, marketing or a related field required
* Minimum of 15 years of previous communications experience in a fast-paced environment
* Mix Agency and inhouse experience preferred
* Demonstrated success leading and collaborating with teams
* Demonstrated experience of influencing without authority
* Experience in the live entertainment, sports or hospitality industry a plus
* Excellent oral and written communication ability
* Strong organizational skills: detail focused, able to handle multiple tasks/projects at a time, meets deadlines
* Focus on internal/external customer needs
* Ability to work well under pressure
* Ability to travel up to 30% of time
* Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Word, PowerPoint and Excel)
* Establish and maintain effective working relationships as required by job responsibility.
* Listen effectively, assesses the situation, determine relevant issues, & suggest solutions


Strengthened by our Differences. United to Make a Difference:

At OVG, we understand that to continue positively disrupting the sports and live entertainment industry, we need a diverse team to help us do it. We also believe that inclusivity drives innovation, strengthens our **people**, improves our **service**, and raises our **excellence**. Our success is rooted in creating environments that reflect and celebrate the diverse communities in which we operate and serve, and this is the reason we are committed to amplifying voices from all different backgrounds.
Equal Opportunity Employer:

Oak View Group is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis (“protected class”) including, but not limited to veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

title: Dishwasher
description:
Job Details

Dishwasher - New York

Legasea New York - 485 7th Avenue, New York, NY 10018

JOB DESCRIPTION

Position Summary: Ensure all service/kitchen-wares are clean and sanitized. Interacts with fellow team members, and supervisors in a polite and courteous manner to ensure gracious hospitality.

Duties and Responsibilities: including but not limited to

· Maintain professional appearance standards as directed in the Tao Group Hospitality Employee Handbook.

· Anticipate and accommodate the needs of all employees.

· Aides in cleaning inside and outside the venue.

· Proper storage and removal of garbage and soiled linens.

· Maintains cleanliness and sanitation of dish station, the kitchen and the entire venue.

· Follow supervisor’s instructions, communicate with and support co-workers while being a team player.

· Possesses in-depth knowledge of the dish machine.

· Possesses in-depth knowledge of proper usage of cleaning chemicals, equipment and supplies.

· Possesses general knowledge of the venue.

· Complies with Department of Health and company sanitation standards.

· Communicates product needs to the chefs and/or purchaser.

· Properly sets-up dish station and performs opening/closing procedures as directed by management, including:

o Stocks stations with prescribed supplies.

o Maintain and clean kitchen equipment.

o Wipes down and sanitizes stations.

o Performs opening side-work as prescribed.

o Performs closing side-work as prescribed.

· Reports all breakage, damage of equipment or furniture immediately to management.

· Attends and participates in daily pre-service meetings (where applicable).

· Attends and participates in any training sessions or departmental meetings.

· Learn by listening, observing other team members and sharing knowledge while leading by example.

· Portrays a positive and professional attitude.

· Demonstrates knowledge of Tao Group Hospitality, its partners and supporting hotel environments.

· Works as part of a team and provides help and support to all fellow team members.

Training Requirements:

· Tao Group Hospitality in-venue Dish Washer training and Food Handling Certificate.

Minimum Education and Qualifications:

· Previous porter and/or Dish Washer experience preferred.

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

· Must be able to stand, lift and bend for extended periods of time.

· Must be able to bend and lift to 50 lbs.

· Role may include job duties or tasks requiring repetitive motion.

· Exposure to hot kitchen elements or cleaning materials.

· Must be able to work and remain focused in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

· Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of varying shifts such as days, evenings, weekends and holidays.

ABOUT US

ABOUT TAO GROUP HOSPITALITY

Tao Group Hospitality delivers distinctive culinary and premium entertainment experiences through its portfolio of restaurants, nightclubs, lounges, and daylife venues. Tao Group Hospitality acquired Hakkasan Group in April 2021. The combined company operates over 80 branded locations in over 20 markets across four continents and features a collection of widely recognized hospitality brands. These include TAO, Hakkasan, OMNIA, Marquee, LAVO, Beauty & Essex, Wet Republic, Yauatcha, Ling Ling, Cathédrale, Little Sister, The Highlight Room, Sake No Hana, Jewel, and more. Tao Group Hospitality is part of Mohari Hospitality, an investment firm focused on the luxury lifestyle and hospitality sectors.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $17.00 per hour

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift

Work Location: In person

title: Fine Wine Consultant, Italian Specialist
description:
If interested in this opportunity, please complete our brief survey by copying and pasting the link below into your web browser.



https://surveys.cultureindex.com/s/SZp28aojTX/86750



Independence Wine & Spirits (IWS) is a vertically integrated distributor of fine wines and spirits with offices in Syosset, Long Island and a new sales office in the heart of New York City. We offer for sale, direct to on and off premise accounts, a carefully selected portfolio of wines and spirits from around the world.


The company represents over 50 top estates and wineries along with a selection of craft spirit distillers. We have direct relationships with these producers and manage the business through the import and distribution tiers of our industry.

  


**Location:** New York, NY

  


**Position Overview:** The purpose of the position is to build and develop sales and distribution of IWS wine and spirits in NY with a focus on Italian fine wine. The role is 100% sales in the metro NY market.

  


**Responsibilities/Essential Functions:**


* Solicit, sell and promote our Italian wines and spirits to an assigned customer base in NY.
* Cold call to increase respective account base.
* Educate the trade and consumers about our brands at tastings and events approved by IWS.
* Sell on the street and handle carrying wine and spirit samples to accounts on a daily basis.
  


**Qualifications/Requirements:**


* Bachelor’s Degree preferred
* 3-5 years of experience in sales
* Strong working knowledge of wine and spirits. Imported wine and craft spirits are a plus
* Self-motivated
* Current account relationships for wine and spirits required
* Strong communication, both written and verbal
* Superior organizational skills, detail oriented, must be able to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines
* Ability to work independently and in a dynamic, high energy, team-oriented atmosphere.
* High level of proficiency with Microsoft office
* Ability to speak French or Italian is preferred

  


**Benefits Overview:**



Independence Wine & Spirits offers a competitive compensation package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(K), paid vacation, personal time off and 11 paid company holidays.

  

*Independence Wine & Spirits is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: Live In Caregivers Needed !
description:
**About Us**


At Elder Care Homecare, we strive to make a positive impact on the lives of our clients. We know that happy employees make happy clients and we reward individuals who are ready to work hard and stay motivated. Every employee at Elder Care Homecare is absolutely critical to its success. Our promise is to keep delivering the same award-winning service and value that our community has come to expect from us through the years.


Interested in applying? **Feel free to send a text or give a call to JOSA at 914-272-5914 and reference Hireology as your referral!**

**What We Offer**

* Flexible Schedule
* Opportunity for paid overtime hours
* 1.5x Holiday pay
* Supportive team
* Increased training
* Pay rate starts at $18.55/Hour

**Responsibilities**

* Provide personal hygiene assistance for elderly patients or those recovering from surgeries, injuries, or accidents by attending to their basic needs, such as showering, bathing, dressing, and eating
* Help clients take prescribed medication and assist clients with ambulation
* Help with mobility around the house or outside (doctor’s appointments, walks, etc.)
* Assist with personal care and hygiene, plan and prepare meals and help with physical therapy exercises
* Complete client’s shopping or accompany them to successfully do so
* Perform housekeeping duties and report any unusual incidents
* Act quickly and responsibly in cases of emergency
* Offer activities that are essential for daily living by assisting patients with their meals, including serving and other tasks, if necessary

**Qualifications**

* Enjoy working in a one-on-one setting, eager to improve and continuously learn new skills
* Ability to lift and/or move up to 50 pounds with the physical capability to perform job-related duties
* Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation every single day
* Validated ability to act in a compassionate and supportive manner
* Available to work different shifts, including nights and/or weekends
* Prior experience in healthcare, hospitality, or in-home care environment (minimum of 1 year)
* Willingness to enforce health and safety standards
* Supportive and compassionate
* High School Diploma or equivalent/Experience as a Caregiver, CNA or HHA, or completion of a CNA Program
* Take pride in providing high-quality care
* Hoyer Lift Experience (specific to client)


We are currently offering in-person interviews in our Westbury office. If applicable, we will set up an appointment for your interview. We look forward to hearing from you!

*We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

title: Customer Success Manager (NYC)
description:
**What Are We Looking For?**


We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Customer Success Manager to join our growing Customer Success team. In this role, you will work to ensure the success and satisfaction of our Enterprise customers by building and maintaining strong customer relationships, leveraging a forward-thinking mindset, data-driven decision-making, collaboration across departments, and a focus on continuous improvement in the customer success process.

  

Requirements:
  

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in a related field.
* Proven experience (3+ years) in a customer success or account management role, in a B2B technology company.
* Experience building strong customer relationships with Enterprise customers and an understanding of Enterprise organizations and structure.
* Excellent presentation, written, and verbal communication skills, with the ability to adapt conversations for technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strategic mindset with the ability to identify and pursue growth opportunities within customer accounts.
* Excellent multitasking capabilities, including prioritizing effectively across a wide variety of tasks and evaluating situational urgency.
* Willingness to travel ~quarterly for customer engagements.
* Knowledge of Conversational AI, Chatbots or Healthcare is preferred but not required.


Offered rate of compensation (NY locations only) will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The base salary range for this position is $70,000 - $90,000 annually. The range provided is for NY-based hires only and will be commensurate with candidate experience. Pay ranges for candidates in other locations other than NY may differ based on the cost of labor in that location.

  

Responsibilities:
  

* Develop and maintain strong, strategic relationships with key clients, owning the relationship and the success of the customer with Hyro.
* Act as the primary point of contact, ensuring a seamless and positive customer experience.
* Create and execute comprehensive strategic success plans aligned with client objectives and company goals.
* Understand the entire customer journey, from onboarding to retention to expansion, and identify opportunities to enhance the customer experience at each stage.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product, marketing, solutions, sales, and partnerships to address client needs and ensure the success of Hyro’s product for the customer.
* Leverage customer data and analytics to make informed decisions, including tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) related to customer success and using data to identify trends and opportunities.
* Promote and advocate for the customer voice internally, helping to create informed decisions cross-functionally and a customer-centric organization.
* Work to identify opportunities for upselling or expanding the relationship with existing customers based on their evolving needs and Hyro's offerings.

  

Equal Opportunities:  

  

***Hyro is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, color, gender, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability or sex.***

title: Service Valet
description:
**Helms Bros Mercedes-Benz is currently looking for a Valet to join their growing team!**


The ideal candidate for all positions must be energetic, punctual, self-motivated and a team player. All candidates must have a valid driver’s license.

 **Service Valet**

* The Valet works on the service drive and assist our clients to ensure we are promptly taking care of them by moving cars, pulling up loaner cars, assisting clients in transferring items to or from their vehicles.
* They are a front line representative that helps in any way possible to keep the process of servicing client's vehicle moving smoothly and efficiently while representing the dealership in a professional, friendly manner at all times.

**Essential Duties:**

* Greet clients when they drive into the service department.
* Record client’s name, VIN, tag number, mileage, and existing vehicle damage.
* Monitor and assist service traffic flow and parking.
* Safely drive client and loaner vehicles into the service lot.
* Ensure clients’ vehicle is clean from their service visit before delivery.
* Adhere to all client service processes.
* The ability to work in a variety of weather conditions including rain and heat
* Performs other duties as assigned. Other duties may be assigned.


Reports any safety issues immediately to management. Other duties may be assigned.

  

Job Type: Full-time

title: Service Advisor
description:
Franklin Sussex Auto Mall is seeking a Service Advisor to join our Sussex, NJ team!



The Nielsen Automotive Group understands the importance of employee satisfaction and how it has a direct effect on our customer experience. Our customer retention keeps our shops extremely busy affording our Advisors the ability to provide well for themselves and their family's. Our dealerships are well respected and we welcome applicants who can adapt to the Nielsen Way as we continue to grow and flourish in our local communities.


**BENEFITS:**


* **FREE COLLEGE OPPORTUNITY!** Online or in-person with Strayer University
* Excellent work environment
* Employee discount plans on purchases and services
* Competitive wages, commensurate with experience
* Health, dental and vision insurance
* Life insurance
* 401k available
* Paid vacation and sick leave


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES:**


* Schedule appointments.
* Greet customers in a timely, friendly manner.
* Obtain customer & vehicle data.
* Communicate with service customers to determine the nature of the mechanical problem.
* Advise customers on the care of their cars and the value of maintaining their vehicles in accordance with manufacturers’ specifications.
* Obtain customer’s signature on repair order.
* Inspect all vehicles for body work, notify the customer that the work is needed, and provide an estimate for body shop work.
* Establish time promised.
* Maintain CSI rating at least comparable to that of the manufacturer, zone or branch average.
* Understand and follow federal, state and local regulations.
* Ensure that all repair orders are accounted for.
* If additional work is needed, explain the details to the customer, including the additional cost and time consideration.
* Provide estimates of labor & parts.
* Follow up progress of each repair order during the day & record on repair order in approved fashion.
* Handle telephone inquiries regarding work in process & appointments and return phone messages promptly.
* Deliver vehicle to customers & answer any questions.
* Interpret warranty information & policies to customers.
* Identify ROs that require special handling such as rush, customer waiting, special problem, comeback.
* Keep Service Manager informed of all problems & potential problems involving repairs, customers & equipment.
* Be up-to-date on technical & performance information on all vehicles serviced by dealership.
* On completion of work, repair orders must be closed in a TIMELY & EFFICIENT manner.


**OTHER DUTIES:**


* Attend any and all required schooling.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* H.S. diploma or the equivalent.
* Ability to read &comprehend instructions & information.
* Two years of experience in a dealership position.
* General knowledge of mechanical operations.
* Professional personal appearance.
* Excellent oral & written communication skills.

title: Payroll clerk
description:
### **Job Description: Payroll Clerk at RootX**



RootX is seeking a detail-oriented Payroll Clerk to join our Finance department. As a Payroll Clerk, you will be responsible for processing payroll, maintaining payroll records, and ensuring accuracy in all payroll transactions.


* Calculate wages, deductions, and overtime
* Prepare and distribute payroll checks
* Address employee payroll inquiries
* Collaborate with HR to ensure accurate employee data


If you have strong numerical skills, attention to detail, and a passion for accuracy, we would love to have you on our team at RootX!

 **Project Manager - HR Department**  



We are excited to announce an opening for a dedicated Project Manager to join our innovative HR department. As a Project Manager, you will play a crucial role in overseeing and coordinating a variety of HR projects to ensure their successful implementation and completion. This position offers a unique opportunity to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, set project timelines, and monitor progress to achieve project goals effectively.

  

Key responsibilities:

  



* Manage and lead HR projects from initiation to closure, ensuring all project objectives are met

  



* Collaborate closely with stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables, fostering strong relationships and alignment

  



* Create and maintain detailed project plans, schedules, and budgets, ensuring resources are allocated efficiently

  



* Proactively monitor project progress, identifying and addressing any issues or risks that may impact project outcomes

  



* Ensure all projects are completed on time and within budget, maintaining a high standard of quality and excellence

  



* Provide regular and transparent communication of project status updates to stakeholders and senior management, ensuring alignment and transparency

  

If you are a proactive problem-solver with exceptional organizational and communication skills, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to be a part of our dynamic HR department. Join us in contributing to the success of our projects and making a positive impact within our organization. Apply now and take the next step in your project management career with us!

title: SEO Manager
description:
### **SEO Manager at RootX**



Join our dynamic Marketing team at RootX as an SEO Manager and help drive our online visibility and growth. As the SEO Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing SEO strategies to increase organic traffic and improve search engine rankings.


* Optimize website content and structure for search engines
* Conduct keyword research and analysis to guide content creation
* Monitor and report on SEO performance metrics
* Collaborate with content creators and web developers to implement SEO best practices


If you are passionate about SEO and have a proven track record of improving search engine rankings, we want to hear from you. Join us at RootX and be part of a team that is dedicated to driving online success through effective SEO strategies.

### **Job Requirements for SEO Manager at RootX**



To be considered for the SEO Manager role at RootX in the Marketing department, candidates must meet the following requirements:


* Proven experience in developing and implementing SEO strategies
* Familiarity with SEO tools and analytics platforms
* Strong understanding of search engine algorithms
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to optimize content for search engines and user experience
* Effective communication and teamwork abilities
* Up-to-date knowledge of SEO trends and best practices

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
### **Product Marketing Manager at RootX**



Join our dynamic Marketing team at RootX as a Product Marketing Manager! In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing strategic marketing plans to drive the success of our products in the market.


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to launch new products and features
* Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs and market trends
* Create compelling messaging and positioning for our products
* Develop marketing campaigns to generate leads and drive product adoption
* Track and analyze the performance of marketing campaigns to optimize results


If you are a creative thinker with a passion for technology and marketing, we want to hear from you! Join RootX and help us bring innovative products to market.

### **Job Requirements for Product Marketing Manager at RootX**



Please ensure that the job requirements for the Product Marketing Manager role at RootX in the Marketing department are clearly outlined and meet the following criteria:


* Minimum of 3 years of experience in product marketing or related field
* Demonstrated success in developing and executing marketing strategies
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make strategic recommendations
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
* Experience in market research and competitive analysis
* Proven track record of launching and promoting products

If the provided requirements do not meet the criteria outlined above, please revise and resubmit. Thank you.

description:

**ZS** is a place where passion changes lives. As a management consulting and technology firm focused on transforming global healthcare and beyond, our most valuable asset is our people. Here you’ll work side-by-side with a powerful collective of thinkers and experts shaping solutions from start to finish. At ZS, we believe that making an impact demands a different approach; and that’s why here your ideas elevate actions, and here you’ll have the freedom to define your own path and pursue cutting-edge work. We partner collaboratively with our clients to develop products that create value and deliver company results across critical areas of their business including portfolio strategy, customer insights, research and development, operational and technology transformation, marketing strategy and many more. If you dare to think differently, join us, and find a path where your passion can change lives.  

  

**Our most valuable asset is our people.**  

  

At **ZS** we honor the visible and invisible elements of our identities, personal experiences and belief systems—the ones that comprise us as individuals, shape who we are and make us unique. We believe your personal interests, identities, and desire to learn are part of your success here. Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts and the networks ZS supports to assist our ZSers in cultivating community spaces, obtaining the resources they need to thrive, and sharing the messages they are passionate about.

  

**Business Technology Solutions Consultant** **- Intern** **What** **you’ll** **do:*** Lead end to end projects using cloud technologies to solve complex business problems
* Provide technology expertise to maximize value for clients and project teams
* Drive strong delivery methodology to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget and to client’s satisfaction
* Ensure technology solutions are scalable, resilient, and optimized for performance and cost
* Guide coach and mentor project team members for continuous learning and professional growth
* Demonstrate expertise, facilitation, and strong interpersonal skills in internal and client interactions
* Collaborate with ZS experts to drive innovation and minimize project risks
* Work globally with team members to ensure a smooth project delivery
* Bring structure to unstructured work for developing business cases with clients
* Assist ZS Leadership with business case development, innovation, thought leadership and team initiatives

 **What** **you’ll** **bring:*** Candidates must be in their first year of a Master's degree specializing in Business Analytics, Computer Science, MIS, MBA, or a related field with academic excellence
* 5+ years of consulting experience in leading large-scale technology implementations
* Strong communication skills to convey technical concepts to diverse audiences
* Significant supervisory, coaching, and hands on project management skills
* Extensive experience with major cloud platforms like AWS, Azure and GCP
* Deep knowledge of enterprise data management, advanced analytics, process automation, and application development
* Familiarity with industry- standard products and platforms such as Snowflake, Databricks, Redshift, Salesforce, Power BI, Cloud.
* Experience in delivering projects using agile methodologies

 **Additional** **skills:*** Capable of managing a virtual global team for the timely delivery of multiple projects
* Experienced in analyzing and troubleshooting interactions between databases, operating systems, and applications
* Travel to global offices as required to collaborate with clients and internal project teams


**Perks & Benefits:**


ZS offers a comprehensive total rewards package including health and well-being, financial planning, annual leave, personal growth and professional development. Our robust skills development programs, multiple career progression options and internal mobility paths and collaborative culture empowers you to thrive as an individual and global team member.


We are committed to giving our employees a flexible and connected way of working. A flexible and connected ZS allows us to combine work from home and on-site presence at clients/ZS offices for the majority of our week. The magic of ZS culture and innovation thrives in both planned and spontaneous face-to-face connections.

**Considering applying?**


At ZS, we're building a diverse and inclusive company where people bring their passions to inspire life-changing impact in global healthcare and beyond. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and recognize the value that candidates with all backgrounds, including non-traditional ones, bring. If you are interested in joining us, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements listed above.

  

ZS is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment and advancement opportunities without regard to any class protected by applicable law.

**To Complete Your Application:**


Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment.


An on-line application, including a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required


to be considered.


NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.
company_description: ZS is a management consulting and technology firm focused on transforming global healthcare and beyond. We leverage leading-edge analytics, data and science to help clients make intelligent decisions.

title: Collections Agent
description:
Makotek is an authorized contractor for Spectrum Cable currently looking for part-time and full-time Modem Pick-Up Representatives for **Mount Vernon, NY** and the surrounding areas. We are able to provide as much work as you are able to take on whether you are looking to do this on the side or start your full-time career at Makotek. Immediate openings are available! No experience is necessary, and we offer paid training. Our Modem Pick-Up Representatives are responsible for driving to the customer’s home in order to pick up modems from Spectrum customers.

**Modem Pick-Up Representative Qualifications:**

* Have a reliable vehicle
* Have auto insurance
* Have an active Driver’s License
* Have a cell phone
* Provide excellent customer service
* Communicate with General Manager at all times
* Abide by all federal, state, and local regulations

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* Weekly paychecks
* Production-based pay with expected earnings of **$800-$1,000 per week**
* Paid training
* Mileage compensation
* Paid vacation
* Available after 60 days of employment: **Medical, Dental, and/or Vision**

**Job Hours:**

· We are hiring both part-time and full-time employees with flexible hours!

· Full-Time = 40+ hour work weeks

· Monday-Friday: 9 AM – 5 PM

**Follow us on social media @MakotekFL across multiple platforms or please feel free to visit by using the links below:**

* Our Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MakotekFL/
* Our Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/makotekfl/
* Our Twitter: https://twitter.com/MakotekFL

**For more information**, please feel free to visit the following:

* Our company’s website: http://www.makotek.net/
* Our Introduction to Makotek video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZU0UGbVae0o

Makotek is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, sex, religion, age, national origin, criminal conviction or arrest record, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws.

Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. Please do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $800.00 - $1,000.00 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Work Location: On the road

title: Dishwasher
description:
Job Details

Dishwasher - New York

Cathedrale New York - 112 East 11th Street, New York, NY 10003

Position Summary: Ensure all service/kitchen-wares are clean and sanitized. Interacts with fellow team members, and supervisors in a polite and courteous manner to ensure gracious hospitality.

Duties and Responsibilities: including but not limited to

· Maintain professional appearance standards as directed in the Tao Group Hospitality Employee Handbook.

· Anticipate and accommodate the needs of all employees.

· Aides in cleaning inside and outside the venue.

· Proper storage and removal of garbage and soiled linens.

· Maintains cleanliness and sanitation of dish station, the kitchen and the entire venue.

· Follow supervisor’s instructions, communicate with and support co-workers while being a team player.

· Possesses in-depth knowledge of the dish machine.

· Possesses in-depth knowledge of proper usage of cleaning chemicals, equipment and supplies.

· Possesses general knowledge of the venue.

· Complies with Department of Health and company sanitation standards.

· Communicates product needs to the chefs and/or purchaser.

· Properly sets-up dish station and performs opening/closing procedures as directed by management, including:

o Stocks stations with prescribed supplies.

o Maintain and clean kitchen equipment.

o Wipes down and sanitizes stations.

o Performs opening side-work as prescribed.

o Performs closing side-work as prescribed.

· Reports all breakage, damage of equipment or furniture immediately to management.

· Attends and participates in daily pre-service meetings (where applicable).

· Attends and participates in any training sessions or departmental meetings.

· Learn by listening, observing other team members and sharing knowledge while leading by example.

· Portrays a positive and professional attitude.

· Demonstrates knowledge of Tao Group Hospitality, its partners and supporting hotel environments.

· Works as part of a team and provides help and support to all fellow team members.

Training Requirements:

· Tao Group Hospitality in-venue Dish Washer training and Food Handling Certificate.

Minimum Education and Qualifications:

· Previous porter and/or Dish Washer experience preferred.

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

· Must be able to stand, lift and bend for extended periods of time.

· Must be able to bend and lift to 50 lbs.

· Role may include job duties or tasks requiring repetitive motion.

· Exposure to hot kitchen elements or cleaning materials.

· Must be able to work and remain focused in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

· Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of varying shifts such as days, evenings, weekends and holidays.

ABOUT US

ABOUT TAO GROUP HOSPITALITY

Tao Group Hospitality delivers distinctive culinary and premium entertainment experiences through its portfolio of restaurants, nightclubs, lounges, and daylife venues. Tao Group Hospitality acquired Hakkasan Group in April 2021. The combined company operates over 80 branded locations in over 20 markets across four continents and features a collection of widely recognized hospitality brands. These include TAO, Hakkasan, OMNIA, Marquee, LAVO, Beauty & Essex, Wet Republic, Yauatcha, Ling Ling, Cathédrale, Little Sister, The Highlight Room, Sake No Hana, Jewel, and more. Tao Group Hospitality is part of Mohari Hospitality, an investment firm focused on the luxury lifestyle and hospitality sectors.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift

Work Location: In person

title: Registered Nurse, RN, Per Diem , Field Home Care Needed
company: Preferred Care at Home of Northwest New Jersey
description:
Preferred Care at Home, NW, NJ is seeking to hire a Per Diem Field RN for Morris and Sussex County areas. The Field Registered Nurse would provide skilled nursing services to clients in their home setting. The Field RN would report directly to the Nurse Field Supervisor. The Field Rn would oversee services provided by Home Health Aides who are assigned to her cases.

**QUALIFICATIONS;**

* New Jersey Licensed Registered Nurse
* Geriatric Home Care experience (Preferred)
* 1- 3 years experience (Preferred)
* Evidence of satisfactory Background screening
* Ability to organize work procedures, assume responsibility and effectively supervise others.
* Demonstrates exceptional assessment skills.
* Weekends (Availability Preferred)

**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

* Makes the initial evaluation visit as required.
* Conducting assessments to identify problems, eligibility for assistance and need for services
* Developing a professional care plan from the assessment findings with client and caregiver
* Performs visits and reports and assumes responsibility for each client assigned to him/her receiving nursing or personal care as needed.
* Supervises Home Health Aides in the client's home.
* Observes infection control practices and uses standard precautions.
* Observes and reports symptoms, reaction to treatments, drugs, and changes in the client's physical or emotional conditions.
* Must have excellent customer service and communication skills.
* Submits required documentation in a timely manner.

**Requirements:**

* **Valid NJ License Registered Nurse (Required)**
* **Malpractice insurance (required)**
* **CPR Certification**
* **Home Health Care Nurse: 1 year (Preferred)**

title: Salad Sandwich Maker
description:
Exit 4 Food Hall is the only food hall in Westchester with 9 food stations. If you have a passion for food this might be a great place to show your talent. We are open 7 days per weeks.

  

The ideal candidate for this position has previous experience preparing a varied menu, enjoys working in a busy restaurant environment and is capable of taking direction well and multi-tasking effectively. If you have restaurant industry experience and a passion for food prep and strong customer service, please submit an application to us today. Pay is an hourly rate plus tips in some positions.

  

Responsibilities include:


Measure and assemble ingredients for menu items


Collaborate with the chef and Cooks to prepare meals during our dining hours


Maintain accurate station food inventories


Properly store food items at appropriate temperatures


Rotate stock items as per established procedures


Make salads and sandwiches


Work with team


Ensure that the food area is cleaned and sanitized at the end of your shift


Work open and close shifts

**REQUIREMENTS**
----------------

* 1+ years’ experience as a Line Cook or food prep
* Excellent communication and organization skills
* Able to work in a fast-paced environment
* Dedicated to food quality and control
* Strong knowledge of proper food handling and sanitation standards
* Good customer service skills
* Must be fluent is English

  

The Exit 4 Food Hall is the first of its kind in Westchester County offering local, freshly-prepared food and drinks. Here you can find a true dine-around experience among 9 different food stations in a full-service setting — a throwback to one-stop dining. The food emphasizes locally-sourced and artisanal crafted items, with constantly changing menus featuring fresh and seasonal food. Our mantra is "slow food....fast." Exit 4 is also highly focused on providing a casual, fun, and communal experience with an eclectic décor highlighted by one-of-a-kind items with local ingredients prepared our way. We believe in sustainability and leaving the smallest carbon footprint possible-We support our community by giving the gift of food and supporting all local organizations. Most important we treat our employees as family. Take a look at our website, exit4foodhall.com

description:
**King O’Rourke Cadillac, Buick, GMC in Smithtown, family owned & operated for over 40 years is seeking to hire an EXPERIENCED F&I Manager. Strong product sales required.**


**This is a rare and unique opportunity to work at Long Island's Largest Cadillac, Buick, & GMC Dealership!**


**BEST PAY PLAN ON LONG ISLAND!**


**We work with all the right banks and you'll have plenty of new & pre-owned turns. Come join the top GM Dealer in the NY Zone.**


**WE BELIEVE OUR EMPLOYEES ARE OUR GREATEST ASSET - As such, we treat all employees with respect and appreciation for their contributions to the company. We believe not only in providing ongoing training, but also rewarding outstanding effort and results through bonus and commission programs.**


**View our** **Careers Page here** **to see what it's like to work at King O'Rourke Auto Group!**


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Work with comprehensive menu selling process to maximize the finance department's overall profitability and product penetration
* Review and inspect the flow of the department’s paperwork on a daily basis to ensure a timely turnaround on all deals
* Ensures all deals are fully compliant with local, state, and federal guidelines
* Demonstrate commitment to supporting the sales department in achieving its goals
* Be an example of professional morals, ethics, and excellent customer service
* Work closely with the sales team on enforcement of proper selling methods


**We are seeking to hire someone with the following skills:**


* Prior automotive experience mandatory
* Strong product sales mandatory
* Knowledgeable, motivated & assertive
* Must have good paperwork and contract skills
* Excellent communication, follow-up and customer service skills
* Professional appearance and work ethic
* Knowledge of regulatory and compliance requirements
* Ability to work within a fast paced environment


**Benefits:**


* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Retirement plan


**We will provide you with the following:**


* A base salary, based on your level of experience
* Aggressive end of the month bonus plan
* 401k Plan with matched dollars
* Health & dental benefits
* Paid time-off, Paid holidays, Paid vacation, etc.
* Monthly, quarterly, year-end bonuses available


We have a state of the art facility in which to work in, with a very supportive management staff, that is here to ensure your success!



For further information on this rare opportunity, please call GM Jim Pflumm @ (631) 724-4700 ext. 121 or to apply online please attach your resume below.

title: Residential Support Staff
description:
Homeless Solutions has been the leading provider of shelter and affordable housing and related supportive services in Morris County for 40 years. Our talented and compassionate staff make a difference every day in our community by providing access to safe and affordable housing to those in need.


The Residential Support Staff role at Homeless Solutions, Inc. is responsible for providing client services to assist in the safe and effective operation of our Shelter facilities, including front desk coverage. This role is an on-site, hourly, non-exempt position reporting to the Residential Support Division Manager.


This role provides administrative support to management by answering and directing callers and on-site visitors to their destination, referring callers to resources and receiving and dispersing messages.


Duties and Responsibilities will include working with Case Management Staff to understand the individual needs and services for shelter clients to best facilitate their success in our programs, as well as:

* Routine paperwork.
* Daily census/attendance sheets.
* Maintain Medication Delivery Log.
* Transportation lists.
* Greet and admit guests, volunteers and visitors according to HSI procedures.
* Conduct wellness checks for staff, guests and visitors.
* Prepare Communication log and Daily Flow report.
* Follow up with RSS and Facilities Management to ensure maintenance requests are completed in a timely manner.
* Provide physical and client related tasks which include:
* Enforce basic hygiene.
* Conduct drug and alcohol testing.
* Conduct searches for contraband.
* Distribute and record medicine administration.
* Perform regularly scheduled security checks
* Monitor approved smoking area.
* Monitor rooms/common area nightly for cleanliness.
* Assign chores and supervise completion.
* Provide guest transportation.
* Perform regular basic cleaning protocols to facilitate a healthy physical environment.
* Other responsibilities include:
* Assist Volunteers and the Volunteer Manager at meal times and/or prepare meals when necessary.
* Cross train with Transitional Housing Residential Support Staff to provide coverage when needed.
* Provide clerical assistance for programs in support of case management staff as requested
* Contact police, fire and rescue personnel in an emergency.
* Refer all Media to HSI CEO.
* Participate in staff meetings and in-service training.
* Exhibit strong personal accountability and awareness of and adherence to company standards, policies, procedures and processes in all aspects of employment with HSI.
* Clearly communicate issues, concerns or recommendations regarding clients or operational issues to the RSS Division Manager or Case Management Staff.
* Respond professionally to the need for flexibility in response to organizational changes.

**Requirements**


* High School Diploma.
* Knowledge, skills and abilities:
* Good oral, written and basic computer skills.
* Regular and predictable attendance and reliable transportation are required during the scheduled hours for this position.
* Physically capable of lifting and carrying supplies, up to 30 pounds.
* Ability to occasionally move about inside the residential housing facility, including navigating stairs and ramps.
* Ability to perform the responsibilities of this role on site at all HSI facilities.
* Clarity of vision at close and long range.
* Mental Health Care and/or Administrative experience is a plus
* Experience working in a shared living environment is a plus.
* Flexible schedule is a plus.

**NOTE**: Some tasks/assignments are shift specific.


Full time permanent staff of Homeless Solutions are eligible to enroll in fully paid medical, dental and life insurance coverage plans in accordance with HSI policies. In addition, all staff are eligible immediately upon hiring to participate in a 401k retirement savings plan, including up to a 6% company paid match. Generous PTO plans include paid personal, vacation and sick leave as well as 10 floating holidays annually.


HSI is an equal opportunity employer, and we appreciate and celebrate the diversity of our staff. We believe that diversity not only includes race and gender, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion and many other parts of an individual's identity. HSI recruits, hires, trains, promotes, compensates and administers all policy and actions with equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. The points of view of all of our staff are important, and supporting a culture of inclusion is everyone's responsibility. The Residential Support Staff will have the opportunity to be part of positive change in the lives of the residents in our communities. Rate of pay starts at $15.50 per hour.


Available shifts daily from 4:00 pm to midnight

**All applications must be made through the following link:**
